description:
Everything changed during World War II: American media, the workforce and even the jeans Americans wore. In order to conserve raw materials for the war effort, the United States government mandated all clothing manufacturers to remove a certain amount of metal, fabric and thread from their garments. And so off came the watch pocket rivets, the crotch rivet and the...
Read more
